title: Winged Victory of Samothrace
summary: The Winged Victory of Samothrace, or the Nike of Samothrace,[2] is a votive monument originally found on the island of Samothrace, north of the Aegean Sea. It is a masterpiece of Greek sculpture from the Hellenistic era, dating from the beginning of the 2nd century BCE. It is composed of a statue representing the goddess Nik√© (Victory), whose head and arms are missing, and its base in the shape of a ship's bow.
